title: Agent AI overview
content:
Agent AI is a powerful framework within AI Studio that enables the orchestration of intelligent agents to automate tasks, integrate systems, and involve human decision-making when needed. As part of this initiative, two new record entities have been introduced:

  • Aviator Agent
  • Aviator Session

Aviator Agent

An Aviator Agent is a configurable entity that defines the scope and behavior of an AI-powered agent. Administrators can create and manage agents to perform a variety of tasks.

The Aviator Agent record includes the following tabs:

  • General
  • Workflow
  • User Options
  • Default Values
  • Rules
  • Task Plan
  • Discussions
  • History

General tab

Contains general information on the Aviator Agent. The General tab displays the following fields:
Fields Description

DisplayLabel​

The name of the Agent. A unique identifier required to specify the exact agent being called in Aviator Session business rules. This field is mandatory.

Description​

The Agent description. This field is mandatory.

HumanEffort​

The estimated total time to perform all agent activities. This is an optional field.​

TemplatesUsed​

Link to the Aviator Models (formerly known as Aviator Templates) associated with the Agent record. This field is provided for reference and quick access, allowing admins to easily view or modify the Aviator model if needed. This is an optional field.​

Activities​

The space for the Agent creator to document the activities, tasks, and steps the Agent performs when called. This helps provide clarity on the Agent’s behavior and functionality. This is an optional field.​

Workflow tab

Shows the Aviator Agent instance's current phase within the lifecycle. Aviator agent workflow has 3 metaphases and 4 phases:

You must manually perform the lifecycle transitions of an Aviator Agent.

Build

The Build metaphase contains the following phase:

Plan: Initial phase for a newly created Aviator Agent, until the instance has the required information.

Operation

The Operation metaphase contains the following phases:

Active: In this phase the agents are used while creating Aviator Session.

Inactive: In this phase, the agents are not considered for creating Aviator Session.

Done

The Done metaphase contains the following phase.

Retired: The Aviator Agent is inactive.

Discussions tab

Displays discussions related to the Aviator Agent instance.

History tab

Shows the change history of the Aviator Agent instance.

Aviator session

An Aviator session is automatically generated when the record creation business rule is triggered by certain entities, including Article, Incident, Change, Request, Actual Service, Release, Company, and Device. When creating an Aviator session, it requires several mandatory fields: Display Label, Source (Entity), Input Rich Text 1, and AI Agent.

The Aviator Session record includes the following tabs:

  • General
  • Workflow
  • Task Plan
  • Discussions
  • History

General tab

Contains general information on the Aviator Session. The General tab displays the following fields:
Fields Description

DisplayLabel​

 The name of the Agent. A unique identifier required to specify the exact agent being called in Aviator Session business rules. This field is mandatory.
Status Indicates the current and final state of the Agent session. Possible values include: Not Started, Awaiting Approval, Approved, In Progress, Completed Successfully, Completed with Errors, Failed to Complete, Cancelled.
TimeSaved Estimated time (in minutes) that the Agent saves by performing its tasks. This value is derived from the Aviator Agent configuration.
ActualStart Timestamp marking when the Agent enters the active phase and begins execution.
ActualFinish Timestamp marking when the Agent session ends and exits the active phase.
CreationTime Timestamp of when the session record was initially created. Typically a system-generated field.
LastUpdate Timestamp of the most recent update to the session record. Typically a system-generated field.
SourceID Unique identifier of the record that triggered the Agent.
AIAgent Reference link to the associated Aviator Agent record.
InputSmallText1 Temporary storage for small text input used in data processing or transmission to Aviator.
InputSmallText2 Additional temporary storage for small text input used in data processing or transmission to Aviator.
InputRichText1 Temporary storage for rich text input used in data processing or transmission to Aviator.
InputRichText2 Additional temporary storage for rich text input used in data processing or transmission to Aviator.
OutputSmallText1 Temporary storage for small text output received from Aviator.
OutputSmallText2 Additional temporary storage for small text output received from Aviator.
OutputRichText1 Temporary storage for rich text output received from Aviator.
OutputRichText2 Additional temporary storage for rich text output received from Aviator.
SourceRequest Reference to the originating Request that triggered the Agent.
SourceIncident Reference to the originating Incident that triggered the Agent.
SourceArticle Reference to the originating Article that triggered the Agent.
SourceChange Reference to the originating Change that triggered the Agent.
SourceRelease Reference to the originating Release that triggered the Agent.
SourceCompany Reference to the originating Company that triggered the Agent.
SourceDevice Reference to the originating Device that triggered the Agent.
SourceActualService Reference to the originating Actual Service that triggered the Agent.

Workflow tab

Shows the Aviator Session instance's current phase within the lifecycle. Aviator agent workflow has 4 metaphases and 5 phases:

  • Metaphases:

    • Planning
    • In Progress
    • Validation
    • Done (End)

  • Phases:

    • New
    • Plan
    • Active
    • Review
    • Completed
       

The lifecycle of an Aviator Session has the following transition phases:

Transition phase Transition type Description

New > Plan

Automatic

When AI agent field is filled, it moves to Plan phase.

Plan > Active

Automatic

 When the AI Agent's phase ID is in the Active state and the current task plan is successful.

Plan > Completed

Manual

 When the task plan is successful, it moves to the Completed phase manually.

Active > Review

Automatic

 When the current task plan is successful, failed, or cancelled, it moves to the Completed phase.

Review > Completed

Automatic

When current task plan is successful.

Review > Plan

Manual

 When the Aviator Session is in the Review phase, it moves to the Plan phase.

Discussions tab

Displays discussions related to the Aviator session instance.

History tab

Shows the change history of the Aviator Session instance.

Reports and insights

Agent AI provides actionable analytics to help measure impact and optimize performance:

  • Execution Metrics: Track how many times each agent has been executed.
  • Time Savings: Quantify total human time saved through automation.
